dynamic_line: Stranger, I sell BL9-infused weapons, armor, resources, some of which I convert too, BL9-infused robots, healing sprays which are of a VERY high quality! These all use benevolent version of BL9 so it's not that weaponized vile thing these factions use. BL9-infused robots are air, ground allies, which can smash, attack from range, stun your enemies. You craft ammo, various melee weapons as well, according to 'BL9' recipes in your PDA or Notebook or whatever. Initial types of ammo, melee weapons have no fabrication, mechanics skill requirements, but further have requirements of level 5 of each along with level 8 of each for even stronger ammo along with melee weapons. You use BL9 samples resources to do that, which can be found as loot from enemies, which I also sell. It's true, stranger, there is gear so rare in some places that even I would not sell it to anyone! I will tell you about it if you ask me where these places are, maybe I have some copies of maps, stranger

dynamic_line:
That's so kind of you to ask, stranger! I have had a lot of adventures during my time in Spain which is a wonderful country with a great language, but there were some creepy things there! Creepy zombified villagers in gloomy villages, cannibalistic cultists in a true madman's castle, heavily armed militia on an island of a terrorist mutant! Castle along with Island that these conquerors mooks built here are merely imitations. I met some great people there too! Espagnol scientist, buffed up American looking mercenary, agile American looking agent even. Scientist got killed after he tried to atone for his unethical experiments because he was doing work for these terrorists. Buffed up soldier was an arrogant wanker, who, as I have later learned, did work for these terrorists too, he was killed when he tried to kill that agile American agent.
 
    Now, stranger, American agent was a very fine, sleek man, a dream of women, a dream of some men too! Like in that song, this story would have been nothing if there had not been a woman or a girl! There were two fine women, but I found one more pleasant to be around than other. American looking president's daughter, who was kidnapped, along with an American Asian spy of some sorts.

Well, former was a very sweet, friendly girl, had that innocent but strong look of an honest, respectable woman in her eyes, not an arrogant like of some rich brat. It was pleasant to be around her. But latter? She was spreading that aura of a dangerous attraction, manipulativeness. It would be hard to avoid her temptations, how alluring she is, if you don't think rationally. I didn't like her much. Type of a woman who would cut someone's throat while pretending to be a friend or even like said someone you or whatever lies manipulators say. I can sound harsh towards her, she did help that agent many times but she did work for that genocidal maniac! But agent with president's daughter? These two made me feel at home there, I am sure that these two are safe somewhere out there, like boulder puncher with his military partner along with his sister as well!
 
    Then I moved here because I've heard of world agencies investigating XEDRA experiments. You know, I thought that a single city would be destroyed with a nuke, like with That City, but some wanker in their leadership likely forced these scientists not only to wear ridiculous ties, but also to do more and more interdimensional experiments which resulted in this mess.

It's no wonder that questionable ethics of XEDRA's leadership have resulted in all of this, like I have said! We've got all of these hostiles because of them, including these invaders. The struggle of survival against The Blob creatures, the tension that can surface between survivors, some of whom can tear each other apart for food or rations. Luckily, based on rumors from madness going on in Eastern Europe between alien forces, there are stories of an interloper with a crowbar who contributes to getting us out of this pit with each blast he makes at these interdimensional militaristic wankers, to get our power up again. 
 
    I don't believe in that whatever forces 'Alliance' along with rebels fight there against are our benefactors. They are just as horrible as 'Alliance', negotiating with them is like standing in sandtraps that they devised themselves to try to make us fall for them. So let's just hope that this one particular anticitizen with a crowbar will be able to help his rebels to get rid of both 'Alliance' along with these other sleek alien forces, I mean, they have already destroyed their citadel from what I have heard. Now, that was a long story, but we've got our own fight to continue for the sake of each of us, for the sake humanity, stranger

Hmm, stranger, there is this adventurer mate, always moving around, scattering some kind of intel, seeks for survivors that can help with some work that requires lots of combat skills. This mate introduced me to the knowledge of the secret benevolent type of BL9 research organization, the GOOD kind of it, stranger, they want to restore civilization, help people survive, create medicine, build shelters, help people to procreate, they work discreetly yet they actually help with building, protecting communities of survivors

My role? Oh, stranger, I'm merely a survivor, an avid rarity and treasure collector that knows...ways around BL9 and some of it's vile carriers, but from more intelligent ones I have to hide, because, you know, I support this benevolent organization that helps all of us to survive, though, I also try to gain profit from skilled adventurers like you, of course! Now, how do I have such relations with each of these factions, though? That's a long story, I don't want to bore the freak outta you, stranger...

You fascinate me, stranger! I presume that you are a little oblivious to this key goal that these different factions have in common, all of them. These cultists, military, alien invaders, they are all the evil hostile forces, trying to acquire BL9 to dominate the world! They become stronger and stronger with time which we can notice easily. To counter them effectively, we need to acquire better gear. Some of it I sell, stranger, but there is gear, which also uses benevolent version of BL9, some of which is even stronger than gear that I sell. Maybe I have it, but it's so rare that I would not sell it to anyone! That's because it can be found in their lairs, bases. Look, stranger, BL9 Safety Bases really are great shelters to live in, almost a luxury for us, with their Base Androids having access to hi-tech locating systems to find these places of these hostile forces, stranger

Hmm, stranger, you think these communities of survivors survive by themselves not knowing how to build? Not only this benevolent organization does it's best to use BL9 as a universal material to craft medicine, armor, weapons for survivors to use, they even create these shelters for survivors including you along with me to be able to form communities which can restore civilization hopefully. They also salvage, restore any advanced alien tech that can be valuable for them along with survivors. Stranger, I've even heard of 'Alliance' members turning to rebels siding with this organization as well

You have a bright mind, stranger! Now, of course, I advise you to go to BL9 Safety Bases first to have proper access to information, to live in comfort to get used to better living conditions, also to be much more tactical, much more strategic, because areas outside of them will be gradually filled with their military, getting stronger and stronger. That's just my advice for you if you want to listen. We still need to get progressively stronger as well to be able to counter them which is why you can always ask me for directions. Now, because you insist, you can have these copies of maps for free. Stranger, it's very important that you at least try to collect gear from these hostile forces places, because their lousy patrols gradually evolve into military forces, like I have said. They evolve from cultists with beasts to soldiers with alien militia along with walking amalgamations, so make sure to collect gear, stranger

GOOD QUESTION - for this you need to use the BL9-infused soldering iron - as a repairing tool, BL9 samples - as materials used for repairing, and you need to have sufficiently high fabrication skills, of course. In case you somehow break or loose your weapons, armor or the BL9-infused soldering iron - DON'T WORRY - you can easily buy the said items again from me whereas acquire the BL9-infused soldering iron for free
